section.content: Before we begin… Mathematics is a love/hate topic. It’s understandable from all the rote learning and constant practice at school. We won’t be doing any of that! section.title: 3. Algebra – Speed
section.content: 3. Algebra – Speed We are now going to look at an instance in physics of an equation that is commonly used in everyday life. “Galileo Galilei, an early Italian physicist was the first to measure speed defining it as a distance travelled per unit of time.” In the UK, we commonly use miles per hour, or distance per unit of time as a measure of speed. i.e. 70 miles per hour, is 70 miles travelled in one hour. 3. Algebra – Speed We are now going to look at an instance in physics of an equation that is commonly used in everyday life. “Galileo Galilei, an early Italian physicist was the first to measure speed defining it as a distance travelled per unit of time.” In the UK, we commonly use miles per hour, or distance per unit of time as a measure of speed. i.e. 70 miles per hour, is 70 miles travelled in one hour.

section.title: Speed
section.content: Speed Even though miles per hour is a common measure of speed, physicists like to have standardised units. - For distance, physicists often use metres (m). - And for time, physicists often use seconds (s). - Speed is therefore metres per second (m/s).
